required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Cognitive Benefits of Interactive Mental and Physical Exercise for Older Adults at Risk for or With Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to clarify the benefits to brain health and thinking processes that result from different forms of exercise. This study will examine the effectiveness of cybercycling (virtual reality enhanced stationary cycling) for persons at risk for and with MCI, and compare this with the individual cognitive, behavioral, and physiological effects of physical and mental exercise alone. The Investigators hypothesis that cognitive benefit will be greatest for combined aerobic and cognitive exercise compared to physical and mental exercise alone.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multi-site, randomized controlled trial. Participants will be randomized into one of three conditions for six months: cybercycle-tour, cybercycle-game, or videogame alone. Comprehensive evaluations will include: neuropsychological (e.g., executive function and memory), behavioral (e.g., compliance and effort/watts), physiological (e.g., cardiorespiratory fitness), biomarker (e.g., BDNF), and an expanded neuroimaging pilot. After the six-month intervention period, participants choose whether or not to continue exercising, using any of the three conditions.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in executive function at 6-months
primary_outcome.description: Change in executive function from baseline at 6-months will be assessed by using a composite executive function score obtained from scores on Digit Span Backwards, Stroop, and Color Trails.

secondary_outcome.description: Weight and other physiological factors will be assessed at baseline, 3-months, 6-months, and 1-year follow-up
Behavioral outcomes (e.g., mood) will be assessed using the Brunel Mood Scale and exercise induced feeling inventory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in executive function at 3-months
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in executive function will be assessed using composite executive function score obtained from scores on Digit Span Backwards, Stroop, and Color Trails.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in executive function at 1-year follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in executive function will be assessed using composite executive function score obtained from scores on Digit Span Backwards, Stroop, and Color Trails.

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in BDNF at 6-months
other_outcome.description: BDNF levels (collected from saliva samples) at 6-months will be compared with baseline levels.

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in MRI at 6-months
other_outcome.description: MRI scans collected at baseline and 6-months will be analyzed for volumetric changes.

other_outcome.measure: Cognitive characteristics of sample pre- and post- intervention
other_outcome.description: The MoCA, ADAS-Cog word recall, complex figures, and controlled oral word association test will be used to characterize the sample based on cognitive function at pre- and post-intervention.

other_outcome.measure: Assessment of exercise behavior during intervention
other_outcome.description: Participants are asked to exercise 3-5x/week. After each exercise session subjects will record their exercise data (e.g., time, distance, power, heart rate, calories, points).

arm_group.description: Combined aerobic & cognitive exercise for 6 months, 3-5x/week.

intervention.description: Exercising on a virtual-reality enhanced stationary recumbent bicycle while playing interactive 3D video-game for 6 months, 3-5x/week.
Exercising on virtual-reality enhanced stationary recumbent bicycle and pedaling through interactive 3D scenic bike tours for 6 months, 3-5x/week.
While seated on a stationary recumbent seat play interactive 3D video-game for 6 months, 3-5x/week (no pedaling).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 50+
- able to pedal recumbent stationary bicycle
- available for regular exercise participation 3-5x/week for at least 6 months
- physician permission to exercise
Exclusion Criteria:
- unstable heart condition or other significant cardiovascular history (e.g,. stroke)
- meets criteria for Alzheimer's or other dementia
- significant history of other neurological disease (e.g., seizures, Parkinson's, etc.)
- physician denial to exercise

facility.name: Sidney Albert Albany Jewish Community Center
